meanings.definition: A natural or necessary accompaniment or adjunct.
meanings.sent1: The beautiful garden was an appanage to the charming cottage.
meanings.sent2: The dessert was a perfect appanage to the delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy considered the squeaky toy as its appanage.
meanings.sent4: Laughter seemed to be the appanage of their joyful friendship.
meanings.sent5: The colorful decorations were an appanage that made the party unforgettable.

meanings.sent1: The small island was an appanage of the main landmass.
meanings.sent2: The appendix is considered an appanage of the digestive system.
meanings.sent3: The little bell was an appanage to the larger church bell.
meanings.sent4: The tiny star was like an appanage to the bright moon in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The small pouch was an appanage that completed the set of accessories.

meanings.definition: A right or privilege attached to a position or office.
meanings.sent1: The key to the executive washroom was seen as an appanage of the CEO.
meanings.sent2: The royal crown was a symbol of the king's appanages.
meanings.sent3: The golden badge was considered an appanage by the security guard.
meanings.sent4: The exclusive parking spot was like an appanage for the top executive.
meanings.sent5: The special access card was an appanage that granted entry to restricted areas.
